com.github.sdorra.database

Interface Database

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DerbyDatabase

    public interface Database
    The database interface helps to interact with the started in-memory database.
    Author:
    Sebastian Sdorra

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Connection createConnection()
      Create a new jdbc connection.
      void execute(Object contextClass, String resource, String encoding)
      Loads and executes an sql script from the classpath.
      String getDriver()
      Returns the jdbc driver class for the in-memory database connection.
      String getUrl()
      Returns the jdbc url for the in-memory database connection.
      boolean isRunning()
      Returns true if the the database is running.
      void shutdown()
      Shutdown the in-memory database.
      void start()
      Starts the in-memory database.

    • Method Detail

      • createConnection

        Connection createConnection()
        Create a new jdbc connection.
        Returns:
        new connection

      • execute

        void execute(Object contextClass,
           String resource,
           String encoding)
        Loads and executes an sql script from the classpath.
        Parameters:
        contextClass - context object is used to obtain the class loader
        resource - path to the sql script
        encoding - encoding of the script

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Shutdown the in-memory database. This method is automatically invoked, after the execution of the unit test.

      • start

        void start()
        Starts the in-memory database. This method is automatically invoked, before the execution of the unit test.

      • getDriver

        String getDriver()
        Returns the jdbc driver class for the in-memory database connection.
        Returns:
        jdbc driver class

      • getUrl

        String getUrl()
        Returns the jdbc url for the in-memory database connection.
        Returns:
        jdbc ulr

      • isRunning

        boolean isRunning()
        Returns true if the the database is running.
        Returns:
        true if the the database is running
